title: Prometheus (opera)
text:
Prometheus is an <a href="opera">opera</a>tic 'Szenisches Oratorium' (scenic oratorio) in five scenes by <a href="Rudolf%20Wagner-R%C3%A9geny">Rudolf Wagner-Régeny</a>, with a German <a href="libretto">libretto</a> by the composer after <a href="Aeschylus">Aeschylus</a>. The opera also uses Goethe's poem "<a href="Prometheus%20%28Goethe%29">Prometheus</a>".
Performance history.
It was first performed on 12 September 1959 at the <a href="Staatstheater%20Kassel">Staatstheater Kassel</a> and revived in concert three times in <a href="East%20Berlin">East Berlin</a> between 1960 and 1984.
Synopsis.
<a href="Prometheus">Prometheus</a>, chained to his rock by <a href="Zeus">Zeus</a>, prophesies that the saviour of mankind will appear after ten generations.
